intro: Mecardonia montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevideo mecardonia, is a flowering plant native to Uruguay. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has small, narrow leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, hairy seeds. Mecardonia montevidensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native environment.
